newsitem.title: MAURITIUS: Mauritius rupee weakens on dollar and pound.
newsitem.headline: Mauritius rupee weakens on dollar and pound.

text.p: The Mauritian rupee was fixed weaker against both the dollar and pound on Friday, reflecting international trends, forex dealers said.
The rupee was quoted at a mean rate of 19.9665 against the dollar from 19.9305 on Thursday. Against the pound, the rupee was fixed at a mean rate of 33.0060 from 32.8765 on Thursday.
Dealers said despite low hard currency demands from importers, the rupee was fixed weaker to reflect the stronger dollar in overnight international markets.
"Commercial banks are generally long in dollars for the moment after supply from market interventions over the past days," one dealer said.

Over the week, the central bank was seen selling dollars in the interbank market during an intervention on Monday while the Mauritius Sugar Syndicate made two tender sales of pounds on Thursday and Friday.

For the 1996 harvest season, the Syndicate has been allowed to sell 25 percent of the island's sugar export proceeds directly to banks. The remaining 75 percent is kept by the central bank for market interventions.
